required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of an Investigational Drug Sitagliptin for Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (0431-044)
clinical_study.official_title: Sitagliptin (MK0431) Late Phase II Double-Blind Dose-Response Study - Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this trial is to determine the efficacy and safety of an investigational drug in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percent. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 12 HbA1c percent minus the Week 0 HbA1c percent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Albumin at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline at Week 12 is defined as Week 12 minus Week 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline at Week 12 is defined as Week 12 minus Week 0.

intervention.description: sitagliptin phosphate 25 mg, 50 mg, 100 mg QD, or 200 mg QD 12-weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with type 1 diabetes mellitus

results_reference.citation: Iwamoto Y, Taniguchi T, Nonaka K, Okamoto T, Okuyama K, Arjona Ferreira JC, Amatruda J. Dose-ranging efficacy of sitagliptin, a dipeptidyl peptidase-4 inhibitor, in Japanese patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus. Endocr J. 2010;57(5):383-94. Epub 2010 Mar 24.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Phase II. First patient in: 11 July 2005. Last patient, last visit: 8 March 2006. The study was conducted at 97 centers in Japan.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients 20-75 years of age with type 2 diabetes mellitus and inadequate glycemic control (HbA1c â‰¥6.5% and <10% at Week -2) were eligible for randomization following at least 8 weeks of diet/exercise and antihyperglycemic agent (AHA) wash-off (for patients previously on an AHA), including a 2-week placebo run-in.

group.title: Sitagliptin 25 mg QD
group.description: The Sitagliptin 25 mg group includes data from all patients randomized to receive treatment with sitagliptin 25 mg orally once daily (QD=once daily).

group.title: Sitagliptin 50 mg QD
group.description: The Sitagliptin 50 mg group includes data from all patients randomized to receive treatment with sitagliptin 50 mg orally once daily (QD=once daily).

group.title: Sitagliptin 100 mg QD
group.description: The Sitagliptin 100 mg group includes data from all patients randomized to receive treatment with sitagliptin 100 mg orally once daily (QD=once daily).

group.title: Sitagliptin 200 mg QD
group.description: The Sitagliptin 200 mg group includes data from all patients randomized to receive treatment with sitagliptin 200 mg orally once daily (QD=once daily).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: The Placebo group includes data from all patients randomized to receive treatment with matching placebo orally once daily.

participants_list.participants: Study enrolled slightly more than the target of N=70

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Albumin at Week 12
outcome.description: Change from baseline at Week 12 is defined as Week 12 minus Week 0.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all patients with a baseline value and â‰¥1 post-baseline value for this outcome. For FAS patients with no data at Week 12, the last non-baseline observed measurement was carried forward to Week 12.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Albumin at Week 12
measure.description: Change from baseline at Week 12 is defined as Week 12 minus Week 0.
measure.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all patients with a baseline value and â‰¥1 post-baseline value for this outcome. For FAS patients with no data at Week 12, the last non-baseline observed measurement was carried forward to Week 12.

analysis.p_value_desc: Multiplicity among pairwise comparisons of sitagliptin groups against placebo was adjusted by Bonferroni method in post-hoc manner.
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model with terms of treatment, prior antihyperglycemic medication status and baseline was used for pairwise comparison
analysis.estimate_desc: ANCOVA model with terms of treatment, prior antihyperglycemic medication status and baseline was used to estimate difference of two groups and its 95% confidence interval

analysis.p_value_desc: Multiplicity among pairwise comparisons of sitagliptin groups against placebo was adjusted by Bonferroni method in post-hoc manner.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 12
measure.description: HbA1c is measured as a percent. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 12 HbA1c percent minus the Week 0 HbA1c percent.
measure.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all patients with a baseline value and â‰¥1 post-baseline value for this outcome. For FAS patients with no data at Week 12, the last non-baseline observed measurement was carried forward to Week 12.

analysis.method: Tukeys linear trend test based on ANCOVA
analysis.method_desc: Linear contrast including all groups was tested using ANCOVA model with terms of treatment, prior antihyperglycemic medication status and baseline

analysis.p_value_desc: No multiplicity adjustment was done between trend test of primary analysis and pairwise comparisons, but the multiplicity among pairwise comparisons of sitagliptin groups against placebo was adjusted by Bonferroni method in post-hoc manner.
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model with terms of treatment, prior antihyperglycemic medication status and baseline was used for pairwise comparison
analysis.estimate_desc: ANCOVA model with terms of treatment, prior antihyperglycemic medication status and baseline was used to estimate difference of two groups and its 95% confidence interval

analysis.p_value_desc: No multiplicity adjustment was done between trend test of primary analysis and pairwise comparisons, the multiplicity among pairwise comparisons of sitagliptin groups against placebo was adjusted by Bonferroni method in post-hoc manner.
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model with terms of treatment, prior antihyperglycemic medication status and baseline was used for pairwise comparison
analysis.estimate_desc: ANCOVA model with terms of treatment, prior antihyperglycemic medication status and baseline was used to estimate difference of two groups and its 95% confidence interval

analysis.p_value_desc: No multiplicity adjustment was done between trend test of primary analysis and pairwise comparisons, the multiplicity among pairwise comparisons of sitagliptin groups against placebo was adjusted by Bonferroni method in post-hoc manner.
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model with terms of treatment, prior antihyperglycemic medication status and baseline was used for pairwise comparison
analysis.estimate_desc: ANCOVA model with terms of treatment, prior antihyperglycemic medication status and baseline was used to estimate difference of two groups and its 95% confidence interval

analysis.p_value_desc: No multiplicity adjustment was done between trend test of primary analysis and pairwise comparisons, the multiplicity among pairwise comparisons of sitagliptin groups against placebo was adjusted by Bonferroni method in post-hoc manner.
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model with terms of treatment, prior antihyperglycemic medication status and baseline was used for pairwise comparison
analysis.estimate_desc: ANCOVA model with terms of treatment, prior antihyperglycemic medication status and baseline was used to estimate difference of two groups and its 95% confidence interval

reported_events.desc: Reported overdoses, regardless of association with reported adverse events, were considered as serious adverse events in this study. The patients for whom the event of overdose was reported had no concomitant AEs with the overdose.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
